body.name: I Got a Cheat Skill in Another World and Became Unrivaled in the Real World, Too, Vol. 3 (light novel)
body.description: Next level up—become “god’s” pupil! Yuuya Tenjou has obtained all kinds of powerful skills and abilities and continues to live his new lifestyle in both the other world and his home world. In the Weald, he comes across a "divine beast" rabbit! "I'll train you. In exchange, teach me how to use [magic]." He becomes the pupil of the unrivaled rabbit, and at the same time becomes a teacher to a divine beast. Back in his world, the Ousei Academy Sports Day begins but paparazzi aiming to get full coverage of Yuuya show up! Yuuya carelessly ends things with a single hit, sending the school into an uproar. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I found the third installment very entertaining and can’t wait to see which direction the story will go in the fourth book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars this was good
reviews.reviewText: I can’t wait for the next book to come out this book series is interesting to read anyway I hope you enjoy this book series support. I don’t have a nice day everyone.👍

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really good book
reviews.reviewText: Love this series so much. Can't wait for the next one to come out. Keep up the good work and bring us the next one soon

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good sequel from previous volume.
reviews.reviewText: The story flows nicely and the author does a good job building the world in this story. Finally the main character reaches the kingdom in the fantasy world, nothing original takes places but the story ends in a good cliffhanger. The only but, I found is the scenes in the real world border in ridiculous. I think the author goes overboard with the scenes where the mc shows his strength. But overall a good read, fun and with a cast of cool characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars this series is a riot of laughs
reviews.reviewText: I stick by the title of this review. Read it and enjoy, though I do suggest starting from book one if you don't feel like being lost.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This was really great, or at least exactly the brand of content I was looking for. However, I was hoping for this to cover content that wasn't already unveiled in the anime. It feels almost as though it was a waste of a volume. I guess I imagine anyone consistently buying volume after volume would have watched the anime, and therefore, the content could have been covered in the prologue, which would allow for the story to progress.My point is that while it wasn't bad, I am disappointed it isn't actually new and is missing content already covered. I look forward to and will purchase the next next one in hopes of finding out what happens next though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Six chapters and an epilogue, all covered in the anime. If you have seen the anime there is little point paying the £7 odd for this. Hopefully book 4 will be worthwhile...actually having just read the synopsis of book 4 it is literally the last couple of episodes of the anime.
